articles.description: Justin Rose is relishing the opportunity to live out his "dream" and become the first Englishman to win The Open in 32 years.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Justin Rose 'has chance to live dream' at Royal Troon

articles.description: England have to “kick on” from their strong end to the third day of the second Test against West Indies, says Chris Woakes.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Hosts need to 'kick on' in second Test, says Chris Woakes

articles.description: BBC Sport picks out six highly anticipated swimming races to watch at the Paris Olympics, including Adam Peaty's quest for gold and France's new superstar.
articles.title: Paris Olympics 2024: Six swimming races to watch at the Games

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says former interim boss Ralf Rangnick was "absolutely right" about the club needing "open-heart" surgery.
articles.title: Manchester United: Ralf Rangnick was 'absolutely right' about club's problems, says Erik ten Hag

articles.description: Few would have expected Billy Horschel and Thriston Lawrence to be Sunday's final pairing at The Open. But here we are.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Billy Horschel and Thriston Lawrence are Troon pairing few expected

articles.description: Lando Norris clinches pole position for Sunday’s Hungarian Grand Prix, and says he has nothing to prove despite not winning since May's maiden victory in Miami.
articles.title: Lando Norris has 'nothing to prove' at Hungarian Grand Prix

articles.description: Rafael Nadal books his place in the Swedish Open final by beating Duje Ajdukovic over three sets in Bastad.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal reaches first final since 2022 at Swedish Open

articles.description: The United States come from 16 points down to avoid one of the biggest shocks in basketball history in a dramatic 101-100 victory over South Sudan.
articles.title: USA vs South Sudan: LeBron James helps side avoid huge shock in Olympics warm-up

articles.description: Tadej Pogacar continues his fairytale Tour de France with a fifth stage win to further extend his dominant lead.
articles.title: Tour de France 2024: Tadej Pogacar wins stage 20 to extend yellow jersey lead

articles.description: Matthew Hudson-Smith smashes his European 400m record and Keely Hodgkinson sets a national 800m record as Great Britain's Olympic gold medal hopes produce statement performances in London.
articles.title: London Diamond League: Matthew Hudson-Smith & Keely Hodgkinson set records
